<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return a new BinaryStreamRef with the last \\p N elements removed.  If</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// this BinaryStreamRef is length-tracking and \\p N is greater than 0, then</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// this BinaryStreamRef will no longer length-track.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystreamrefbase/#a25aa9ecfd327d418a3030cc648d751af"><Highlight kind="normal">  RefType <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystreamrefbase/#a25aa9ecfd327d418a3030cc648d751af">drop&#95;back</a>(uint64&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a>)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><Highlight kind="comment">/// BinaryStreamRef is to BinaryStream what ArrayRef is to an Array.  It</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><Highlight kind="comment">/// provides copy-semantics and read only access to a &quot;window&quot; of the underlying</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><Highlight kind="comment">/// BinaryStream. Note that BinaryStreamRef is &#42;not&#42; a BinaryStream.  That is to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><Highlight kind="comment">/// say, it does not inherit and override the methods of BinaryStream.  In</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><Highlight kind="comment">/// general, you should not pass around pointers or references to BinaryStreams</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><Highlight kind="comment">/// and use inheritance to achieve polymorphism.  Instead, you should pass</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><Highlight kind="comment">/// around BinaryStreamRefs by value and achieve polymorphism that way.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystreamref"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">BinaryStreamRef</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><Highlight kind="normal">    : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystreamrefbase/#a49a0d2084d0b02ccf53238b2683b04b8">BinaryStreamRefBase</a>&lt;BinaryStreamRef, BinaryStream&gt; &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">friend</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystreamrefbase/#a49a0d2084d0b02ccf53238b2683b04b8">BinaryStreamRefBase&lt;BinaryStreamRef, BinaryStream&gt;</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystreamref/#ad79b93dab411be639514e8461d620880"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">friend</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystreamref/#ad79b93dab411be639514e8461d620880">WritableBinaryStreamRef</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
